rComments: Brad is really nice although kind of weird. He will judgmentally laugh to himself sometimes when you talk to him. But as a professor he's very clear, and I learned a lot about coding in his class. Although when you go to him for help he tends to do a lot of work for you, which hinders learning.

this has to be the best class brad teaches! the course is super well organized and he does a good job of making sure everyone is always on the same page. his critique style doesn't really feel like a critique. he offers helpful feedback that he expects you to then apply in your own way. definitely not condescending or closed-minded!

This class is required for all art majors, and since its one of the first I took, it takes a bit of getting used to. Brad is great if you are willing to make an effort in the class, but otherwise you may not do so well.
Not very well rehearsed in teaching, I'm sure he has a lot of talent considering his age but really needs to step up his game if he expects students to learn. Hopefully it will get better...
He's a good guy but is obviously new, just started teaching this year and you can tell. I'm sure it will get better with time .
